body:
### Describe the bug

Something is suddenly broken, it still worked 1-2 days before:
```
(borg-env) tw@MacBook-Pro borg % borg -V
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/tw/w/borg/src/borg/archiver/__init__.py", line 23, in <module>
    from ._common import Highlander
  File "/Users/tw/w/borg/src/borg/archiver/_common.py", line 6, in <module>
    from ..archive import Archive
  File "/Users/tw/w/borg/src/borg/archive.py", line 25, in <module>
    from .cache import ChunkListEntry, build_chunkindex_from_repo
  File "/Users/tw/w/borg/src/borg/cache.py", line 28, in <module>
    from .item import ChunkListEntry
  File "src/borg/item.pyx", line 266, in init borg.item
    path = PropDictProperty(str, 'surrogate-escaped str', encode=assert_sanitized_path, decode=to_sanitized_path)
  File "src/borg/item.pyx", line 241, in borg.item.PropDictProperty.__set_name__
    cpdef __set_name__(self, name):
TypeError: __set_name__() takes exactly 1 positional argument (2 given)
```

I did a global search in the code, it never gives more than one argument.

I tried with misc. borg versions (releases from the past) that always worked, tried Python 3.9/3.10/3.313, tried with Cython 3.0.12 and 3.1.0, used an old requirements-locked file, it is now always broken. I didn't change anything related to `__set_name__` recently.

There are no problems while building it, but when executing the code it fails with the above failure.

Any hint what that could be?


### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

borgbackup git tag 2.0.0b12 (quite old) and 2.0.0b16 (current) reproduce the issue.

Here is the relevant code:

```cython


cdef class PropDictProperty:
    """return a property that deals with self._dict[key] of PropDict"""
    cdef readonly str key
    cdef readonly object value_type
    cdef str value_type_name
    cdef readonly str __doc__
    cdef object encode
    cdef object decode
    cdef str type_error_msg
    cdef str attr_error_msg

    def __cinit__(self, value_type, value_type_name=None, encode=None, decode=None):
       self.key = None
       self.value_type = value_type
       self.value_type_name = value_type_name if value_type_name is not None else value_type.__name__
       self.encode = encode
       self.decode = decode

...

    cpdef __set_name__(self, name):
       self.key = name
       self.__doc__ = "%s (%s)" % (name, self.value_type_name)
       self.type_error_msg = "%s value must be %s" % (name, self.value_type_name)
       self.attr_error_msg = "attribute %s not found" % name



cpdef _init_names():
    """
    re-implements python __set_name__
    """
    for cls in PropDict.__subclasses__():
        for name, value in vars(cls).items():
            if isinstance(value, PropDictProperty):
                value.__set_name__(name)

_init_names()
```


### Expected behaviour

Shouldn't crash.

### OS

macOS 15.4.1 (current, all updates)

### Python version

3.9.22 / 3.10.17 / 3.13.3 (from brew, all updated)

### Cython version

3.1.0 (via pip) - updated, it does NOT happen on 3.0.x.

comment_data.body:
Happens on macOS and also on Linux:

https://github.com/borgbackup/borg/actions/runs/14914880261/job/41932910488?pr=8825#step:8:116

https://github.com/borgbackup/borg/actions/runs/14914880261/job/41962585387?pr=8825#step:8:82

I suspect this has to be with the new Cython 3.1 release and that for some reason you haven't managed for force it back to 3.0.

According to the change log

> `__set_name__` is called when assigning to class attributes. (Github issue 6179)

So this is probably us calling it with 2 arguments, not you. 

It'll need a bit more investigation than I can do right now to see if we think there's a bug there.

@da-woods thanks for the feedback, I'll check again with Cython 3.0.x.

...

My fault: I manually installed Cython 3.0.12, but 3.1 was pulled into the buildsystem automatically until I edited it in `pyproject.toml` also:

```
[build-system]
requires = ["setuptools>=77.0.0", "wheel", "pkgconfig", "Cython>=3.0.3,<3.1.0", "setuptools_scm[toml]>=6.2"]
build-backend = "setuptools.build_meta"
```

So, that is a workaround until we find a fix so it also works with Cython 3.1.

Did cython add builtin support? 

In that case I can provide a fix as borg is manually calling it as workaround

> Did cython add builtin support?
> 
> In that case I can provide a fix as borg is manually calling it as workaround

Yes I think it did
https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6179/files - will do a small experiment wrt what def to use
@ThomasWaldmann i have a bugfix ready almost- the signature was wrong for the cpdef and it never errored before - i'll correct the signature and check if i can opt out of the extra call entirely
i believe this can be closed as the error is entirely my fault - should have followed the official signature back when i did the impl
Thanks for the report (even if it turned out to be a non-issue)

title: [BUG] item.pyx -> TypeError: __set_name__() takes exactly 1 positional argument (2 given)
